resources.string: Singleton is a design pattern that ensures that only one entity in the world is available. \n\nWe will show its effect shortly.
Each time the button is pressed, Singleton.getInstance() is called\n
Let\'s see if the ID changes?\n\n

Factory Pattern

Provides a way to create objects without specifying the exact class of object that will be created.

In this demo, we will create different types of characters using a factory.
Abstract Factory Pattern provides an interface for creating families of related or dependent objects without specifying their concrete classes.

Template Method Pattern is a behavioral design pattern that defines the skeleton of an algorithm in a method, deferring some steps to subclasses.

This pattern allows subclasses to redefine certain steps of an algorithm without changing its overall structure.

In this demo, we simulate a data export scenario. The user can select different export formats (CSV or JSON). Based on the selection, the system calls the corresponding subclass implementation and uses a template method to execute:

• openFile()\n
• writeHeader()\n
• writeData()\n
• closeFile()

The order of operations is defined by the template method exportData(), while each format subclass provides its specific implementation for each step.

Press "Start Demo" to explore how Template Method Pattern controls the flow of logic with flexible subclass behavior.
Builder Pattern: Step-by-step construction of complex objects. Allows different representations using the same construction code.
Please press start demo button to see the result
Proxy Pattern provides a surrogate or placeholder for another object to control access to it. \nIn this demo, the proxy delays creation of the real video player and logs the access.

"Prototype Pattern allows objects to be cloned instead of created from scratch. This is useful when object creation is expensive, or you want to avoid dependencies on concrete classes.
" "
" "Key benefits:
" "- Avoids the overhead of new object creation
" "- Simplifies object initialization
" "- Useful for object registries and GUI editors
" "
" "In this demo, you'll see how to clone an existing character template using the `clone()` method and customize it without affecting the original.
"

"This demo demonstrates the Mediator Pattern by simulating a chat room where users send messages through a mediator.
" "
" "The ChatRoom (mediator) manages message delivery, so users do not communicate directly with each other. This reduces tight coupling between components.
" + "
" "Try selecting a user, typing a message, and sending it. You'll see that other users receive the message through the ChatRoom mediator.
"
Please enter your name and message
Send a message to the intermediary (ChatRoom)

"This demo showcases the Command Pattern using a simple light switch.
" "The toggle switch represents a command trigger, allowing the user to turn a light ON or OFF.
" "
" "- Receiver: Light
" "- Commands: LightOnCommand, LightOffCommand
" "- Invoker: RemoteControl
" "- Client: UI Switch interacts with RemoteControl" "The command encapsulates the action, enabling decoupling between sender and receiver."

"This demo illustrates the Chain of Responsibility Pattern.

" "A support request is passed along a chain of handlers:
" "- LowLevelSupport handles simple issues.
" "- MidLevelSupport handles intermediate issues.
" "- HighLevelSupport handles complex or unhandled issues.

" "Each handler decides whether it can process the request or pass it to the next one.

" "Usage:
" "1. Enter a request (e.g., "password reset", "database issue", "network crash").
" "2. Click "Send Request".
" "3. The system will display which handler processed your request.
"

"This demo illustrates the Decorator Pattern.

" "The Decorator Pattern allows you to dynamically add new behavior to objects without modifying their structure.

" "We start with a basic Coffee object and wrap it with additional decorators like Milk, Sugar, and Vanilla.

" "Usage:
" "1. Select ingredients to decorate your coffee.
" "2. Press the "Make Coffee" button.
" "3. The app will display the coffee description and total cost."

"Strategy Pattern lets you define a family of algorithms, encapsulate each one and make them interchangeable.
" "Strategy lets the algorithm vary independently from clients that use it.

" "In this demo, you can choose different discount strategies for a given price:
" "• No Discount
" "• Seasonal Discount (10%%)
" "• Clearance Discount (50%%)

" "Enter a price, select a strategy, and press "Calculate" to see the final price."

"Adapter Pattern allows incompatible interfaces to work together.\n" " In this example, we have a legacy player that only supports MP3.\n" " We use an Adapter to play MP3, MP4, and VLC files via the same interface."

"Iterator Pattern provides a way to access elements of a collection sequentially without exposing its underlying representation.
" "
" "In this demo:
" "- We have a collection of fruit items.
" "- By pressing "Show Items", we use an Iterator to traverse the collection.
" "- The iterator follows a simple pattern: hasNext() to check if more items exist, and next() to get the next item.
" "
" "This demonstrates how to decouple traversal logic from the collection structure.
" "
" "Usage:
" "1. Tap "Show Items" to view the list of items via the Iterator.
" "2. Observe how the logic does not rely on direct list access (no get(index)).
" "
" "This pattern is useful for designing APIs that expose iteration without revealing implementation details."

"The Composite Pattern allows clients to treat individual objects and compositions of objects uniformly.
" "
" "In this demo:
" "- We model a folder structure where a folder can contain files and subfolders.
" "- Each item implements a common interface with the `display()` method.
" "
" "By clicking "Build Structure", we build a sample folder hierarchy and display its contents.
" "
" "This pattern is useful for:
" "- Tree structures (like file systems)
" "- Organizational hierarchies
" "- UI component trees
" "
" "Usage:
" "1. Tap "Build Structure".
" "2. Observe how both files and folders are processed uniformly via the `display()` method."

"The Observer Pattern defines a one-to-many dependency between objects so that when one object changes state, all its dependents are notified and updated automatically.
" "
" "In this demo:
" "- A Subject holds data (e.g. temperature).
" "- Observers register to receive updates when the Subject changes.
" "- When you update the value, all Observers display the change.
" "
" "Usage:
" "1. Tap "Update Temperature".
" "2. Observe how multiple UI components are notified of the change."
Empty tempearture! Please input the non empty value!

"The Facade Pattern provides a simplified interface to a complex subsystem.
" "
" " In this demo, we simulate a music player. Internally, it involves:
" " - Decoding the music file
" " - Loading buffers
" " - Outputting audio to speakers
" "
" " The UI only interacts with the Facade class which handles all the underlying complexity."

"Memento Pattern allows saving and restoring the internal state of an object without violating encapsulation.
" "
" "In this demo:
" "- You can input some text and press [Save] to store the current state.
" "- Press [Undo] to revert the text back to the last saved state.
" "
" "It's useful in situations like Undo/Redo operations in editors."

"The Visitor Pattern lets you add new operations to existing object structures 
" "without modifying those structures.
" "
" "It separates algorithms from the objects on which they operate, enabling:
" "- Open/Closed Principle: Add new operations without altering existing class logic.
" "- Flexibility: You can define multiple visitors for different purposes.
" "
" "In this demo, we will apply multiple visitors to shape objects:
" "1. AreaCalculatorVisitor – to calculate area
" "2. DrawingVisitor – to simulate rendering text"

"The State Pattern allows an object to change its behavior when its internal state changes. 
" "It appears as if the object changed its class.
" "
" "In this demo, we simulate a music player that can be in three states:
" "- Stopped
" "- Playing
" "- Paused
" "
" "Each button changes the state, and behavior depends on the current state.";

"This demo showcases the Interpreter Pattern applied to arithmetic expression evaluation.
" "
" "Supported features:
" "• Basic arithmetic operations:, -, *, /
" "• Parentheses for grouping: ()
" "• Left-to-right evaluation
" "• Integer-only calculation
" "
" "Example expressions:
" "• 3 5 * 2
" "• (4 6) / 2 - 1
" "• 10 - (3 2) * 2
" "
" "Instructions:
" "1. Enter an arithmetic expression in the input field.
" "2. Press "Evaluate" to see the result calculated using Interpreter logic.
" "3. Only spaces between tokens are required (e.g., "3 5", not "3+5").
" "
" "Note:
" "This is a simplified interpreter for demonstration purposes. No floating-point or variable support.";

"The Flyweight Pattern is a structural design pattern that allows sharing of common parts of object state to reduce memory usage.\n\n
" "In this demo, we simulate drawing chess pieces (black or white) on a board. Instead of creating a new object every time, we use a factory to reuse shared instances of black and white pieces.\n\n
" "This helps improve performance and conserve memory, especially when dealing with a large number of similar objects.\n\n
" "Tap the "Add Piece" button to simulate placing pieces on the board and observe that only two instances (black and white) are ever created, regardless of how many you add.
"

"Bridge Pattern
" "
" "The Bridge Pattern is a structural design pattern that decouples an abstraction from its implementation so that the two can vary independently.
" "
" "In this demo, we demonstrate a remote control (the abstraction) that can operate on different devices (the implementation), such as a TV or a Radio.
" "
" "This pattern allows you to extend either the remote or the device independently without modifying the other.
" "
" "Select a device type.
" "Use the toggle and volume buttons to control the device.
" "Observe how the abstraction (Remote) communicates with the device (TV or Radio)."
